subject: Basketball
Athletics and Sports
lead_paragraph: Paul Pierce scored a season-high 32 points and Kevin Garnett had an easy 15 with 7 rebounds Friday night as the Boston Celtics overcame Ray Allen’s absence to beat the visiting Milwaukee Bucks, 104-82. They matched a franchise record with a 12-0 start at home.
